title: Graham-Pollak Sequence
content: The sequence defined by a₁ = 1 and a_{n+1} = ⌊√2(aₙ + 1/2)⌋. This recurrence grows approximately by factor √2 at each step.

title: Graham-Pollak Theorem
content: The difference a_{2n+1} - 2·a_{2n-1} equals either 0 or 1, giving the n-th binary digit of √2.

title: Growth Rate
content: The sequence grows approximately by factor √2, with the ratio a_{n+1}/a_n converging to √2 as n increases.

title: Generalized Sequence for √m
content: The natural generalization: replace √2 with √m in the recurrence. Works for squarefree m.

title: Stoll's Generalization (2005)
content: Extended the digit-extraction method to all quadratic irrationals satisfying ax² + bx + c = 0.

title: Stoll's Further Generalization (2006)
content: Extended beyond quadratic irrationals to certain higher-degree algebraic numbers.

title: Continued Fraction Connection
content: The sequence relates to the continued fraction expansion [1; 2, 2, 2, ...] of √2 and its convergents.

title: OEIS A004539
content: The binary expansion of √2 is catalogued as OEIS sequence A004539: 1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, ...

title: Complete Characterization
content: The sequence satisfies the recurrence, differences give binary digits, and Stoll generalized the result.
